metadata.title: CVE-2018-1308 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
This vulnerability in Apache Solr 1.2 to 6.6.2 and 7.0.0 to 7.2.1 relatesto an XML external entity expansion (XXE) in the `&dataConfig=<inlinexml>`parameter of Solr's DataImportHandler. It can be used as XXE usingfile/ftp/http protocols in order to read arbitrary local files from theSolr server or the internal network.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1308` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblucene3-contrib-java - 3.6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu0.1~esm2
liblucene3-java - 3.6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu0.1~esm2
libsolr-java - 3.6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu0.1~esm2
solr-common - 3.6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu0.1~esm2
solr-jetty - 3.6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu0.1~esm2
solr-tomcat - 3.6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu0.1~esm2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: lucene-solr package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.6.2+dfsg-2ubuntu0.1~esm2').
